glsa.title: OpenSSL: Multiple vulnerabilities
glsa.synopsis: Multiple vulnerabilities were found in OpenSSL, the worst of which could allow remote attackers to cause a Denial of Service condition.

background.p: OpenSSL is an Open Source toolkit implementing the Secure Sockets Layer (SSL v2/v3) and Transport Layer Security (TLS v1/v1.1/v1.2/v1.3) as well as a general purpose cryptography library.

description.p: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in OpenSSL. Please review the CVE identifiers referenced below for details.

impact.p: A remote attacker could perform a malicious crafted TLS 1.3 handshake against an application using OpenSSL, possibly resulting in a Denial of Service condition.
